title: 'Experimental' 13-year-old boy died after inhaling aerosol which he claimed smelt like his mother, inquest hears
text:
An “experimental” 13-year-old boy died after inhaling gas from an aerosol can he said smelt like his mother, an inquest has heard.

Jack Waple had been warned about aerosol misuse buy his mother Susan, after she noticed that deodorant tins were going missing around the house or seemed lighter than usual.

But the young boy was found unresponsive in his bedroom on June 13 with an aerosol can on his bed.

Norfolk's area coroner Yvonne Blake, summarising a statement from Mrs Waple, said: "He assured you nothing was going wrong and said when you went out he was anxious so he sprayed his deodorant about as it smelt like you.

"He asked you to believe him.

"You felt you had to show faith in him."
description: An “experimental” 13-year-old boy died after inhaling gas from an aerosol can he said smelt like his mother, an inquest has heard.
